page.title: 16THE RAIL TRAIL
page.content: The Rail Trail starts at Greenfield village and continues to Etherley, where it crosses the main street and on to Phoenix Row where the original line ends. The line was part of the Stockton and Darlington Railway built in 1825 but superseded in 1843 by the line through Shildon Tunnel to Bishop Auckland and Witton Park, Engineered by George Stephenson. Now you can walk from Greenfield village East along the footpath to Etherley. Little remains of the line except the rubble from the demolished Engine house and some stone slabs with the holes that retained the sleepers. Beyond Etherley incline the the bridge over the main road has been demolished and the line continues to Phoenix row, the site of the original Colliery. Here the line ended with the view of Witton Park ahead in the distance.
